author: terence0083
content: I'm getting `Could not connect to execution endpoint error=Post "http://localhost:8551": net/http: invalid header field value for "Authorization"` when interop with 4844-geth. Did anyone see the same?

author: terence0083
content:
I can confirm this only happens on the eip4844 geth branch and not on the withdrawal or master geth branches. It happens after merging this commit. I'll look more into this

https://github.com/Inphi/prysm/pull/35

author: inphi
content: This should be fixed now. Lemme know if it works for you.

author: roberto.bayardo
content: do you see any panic or unusual errors in the geth logs?

author: terence0083
content: nothing, and I will check if there's any jwt related changes on geth tomorrow

author: jimmygchen
content: <@159152274659082240> <@898563924440543283> I'm not able to run interop with the latest geth version which has the shardingForkTime changes, does this need to be dynamically computed and added to geth genesis before starting interop?

author: roberto.bayardo
content: right the interop stuff no longer works with those changes as we need an updated CL client

author: roberto.bayardo
content: a bunch of changes going on in parallel ... hopefully we can start to converge again and then make all the interop tests start post-merge

author: jimmygchen
content: ah i see, thanks!

author: roberto.bayardo
content: Hmm, this might be similar to what Jimmy is seeing: the latest 4844 interop geth is no longer compatible with the older 4844 interop prysm which has fallen quite behind. So pulling in older commits from that prysm repo could prove problematic.

author: dapplion
content: Listening to call EIP-4844 Implementers' Call #7, want to double check: Is Geth or any EL ready to interop with a CL on eip-4844 rebased on capella?

author: __flcl
content: Nethermind is trying to confirm, a CL configuration to run post-merge network with shanghai/sharding fork applied instantly could help a lot

author: dapplion
content: Sure just set all *_FORK_EPOCH values here to 0. https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/9839ed49346a85f95af4f8b0cb9c4d98b2308af8/configs/mainnet.yaml#L52 AFAIK all clients can support boostraping from that

author: dapplion
content: Is your Prysm eip-4844 branch rebased on capella already? How far have you got interoping with Geth?

author: tbenr

author: g11tech
content: hi <@159152274659082240> , is the geth image/branch rebased on withdrawals available? we want to test full interop with everything activated

author: inphi
content: Yes. It's the `eip-4844` branch on this repo - https://github.com/mdehoog/go-ethereum/

author: terence0083
content: it is rebased, I've been trying to interop with geth but getting auth error with any engine calls, will look more into this today

author: roberto.bayardo
content: Let me know if I can help. I do expect there to be more issues in the geth fork since the latest changes have not yet been tested while interoperating with an appropriately updated CL client.  Hopefully any issues should be minor.

content: Yeah. I'm still trying to pin point the commit. `4ace6f3331a187408d9bef2eff1afc62c4e68523` works for me

author: roberto.bayardo

author: terence0083
content:
Made this: https://hackmd.io/q1SLCaubTIWw_1zsEjW_Vg?view. Hope it's helpful

You dont need to start the validator client, it's enough to just start beacon node and geth to observe the error at startup

author: roberto.bayardo
content: In the process of firing this up, noticed in the genesis.json config you have shanghaiBlock whereas it should be shanghaiTime

author: terence0083
content: got it thanks, I'm working on simplifying the instructions too, it should be easier to produce where we just need a beacon node and geth to connect at start-up

author: terence0083
content: <@898563924440543283> I dont think the issue is on your end. It's most likely us. I was able to reproduce something similar on latest develop and latest geth on a different testnet: https://hackmd.io/@vianq8jgSjC9fiZvnjcAvw/rJqbHtRvs

author: dcbuilder
content: hello, could someone please give me an estimate whether a c5.2xlarge is enough to run devnet3? Wondering what specs would our infra need https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/c5/

author: inphi
content: I think that machine size should suffice. The requirements for devnet3 are similar to what CL clients recommend. One other thing is an additional 100 GB disk for blob storage. Though I doubt devnet3 will be online long enough to require that much storage.
